page.title: 14Transport
page.content: {Bus services. There are 9 council bus routes running through the Rectangle and many other private bus services.The central bus depot is situated at Tir-y-berth,where the council buses,vans and lorries are serviced and kept in good condition. Each bus costs Â£58000,and it cost Â£10000 a year to maintain each bus. A bus lasts approximately 15 years.Tyres are hired from Michelin rubber 2p a mile. {Train services. The main Rhymney to Cardiff railway line,passes through the rectangle with stations at{Pengam}and{Hengoed.}At Cardiff passengers can catch trains to any part of the United Kingdom. {Nissan Cars. Are sold at Charles Jenkins Garage Tir-y-berth.They are shipped from Japan to Worthing in England.
